183.title: Generation - Transportation - Storage - Treatment - Management And Disposal Of Regulated Medical Waste
183.description: Requires hospitals and pharmacies to provide sharps containers for public use.

185.title: Access To Opioid Analgesics With Abuse-deterrent Properties
185.description: Requires policies and plans issued by health insurers to cover abuse-deterrent drug formulations of opioid analgesics in the same manner in which the policies and plans cover non-abuse deterrent drugs formations.

186.title: Identity Theft Protection
186.description: Creates the Identify Theft Protection Act of 2015, to protect personal information from unauthorized access, use, modification, destruction or disclosure, and to preserve the confidentiality and integrity of such information.

188.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
188.title: Abandonment Of Cats
188.description: Exempts a "licensed releasing agency" from the offense of abandoning cats.

189.title: Public Health And Workplace Safety Act
189.description: Requires smoking bar owners to demonstrate on a quarterly rather than annual basis that revenues generated from tobacco products exceeds revenue generated from food and beverage sales.

190.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
190.title: Children
190.description: Increases the minimum age to buy and sell tobacco products from eighteen (18) years to twenty-one (21) years.

191.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
191.title: Get On Your Feet Loan Forgiveness Program
191.description: Established "The Get On Your Feet Loan Forgiveness Program" in Rhode Island, to assist recent college and university graduates in the repayment of their student loans.

192.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
192.title: Motor Vehicle And Trailer Excise Tax Elimination Act Of 1998
192.description: Amends the provisions of the general laws relating to the state car tax in order that the assessment of used motor vehicles would be based on the average trade-in price, rather than retail price.

193.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
193.title: Tuition Equity
193.description: Creates the "Student Equal Economic Opportunity Act" which would identify those students who are exempt from paying nonresident tuition at public universities, colleges or community colleges.

194.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
194.title: Human Resource Investment Council
194.description: Provides for a wage reimbursement incentive for employers participating in the non-trade apprenticeship program and permits the governors workforce board to establish rules and regulations for the program.

195.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
195.title: Administrative Procedures Act
195.description: Directs the office of management and budget to develop a plan to implement a centralized administrative hearing agency.

197.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
197.title: Attachment
197.description: Provides that child support garnishment be paid first before any other garnishment including a garnishment for the payment of taxes.

198.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
198.title: State Purchases
198.description: Increases the minimum amount of a state purchase subject to competitive bidding.

200.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
200.title: Relating To State Budget
200.description: Requires that the governor submit a zero based budget to the general assembly. The zero based budget would be phased in over a five (5) year period.

202.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
202.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Liability And Computation
202.description: Prohibits the collection of a sales or use tax on that portion of a motor vehicle lease payment representing taxes payable by the lessor on the leased motor vehicle.

203.title: Estate Taxation
203.description: Requires the state tax administrator to provide written notice of the existence of a lien on real property owned by a decedent, to his or her executor, administrator, heirs-at-law and surviving joint tenant.

207.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
207.title: Housing Resources -- Homeless Shelters
207.description: Establishes a homeless shelter standards commission.

209.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
209.title: Gambling And Lotteries
209.description: Permits social gaming at certain locations where gambling is incidental to a bona fide friendship and only players of the game would receive anything of value.

210.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
210.title: Criminal Transmission Of Hiv
210.description: Creates a criminal offense for knowingly transmitting HIV to another person.

211.title: General State Officers
211.description: Enables the general assembly in grand committee to fill a vacancy in the office of the lieutenant governor.

212.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
212.title: Procedure In Particular Actions
212.description: Provides that no party would be deemed jointly liable in tort for an injury to person or property unless it is determined that such person is at least fifty-one percent (51%) liable in tort for the injury.

213.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
213.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Contributions Among Joint Tortfeasors
213.description: Requires that a tortfeasor's share of a judgment be borne by all parties to the action in accordance with their pro rata share of culpability whenever a tortfeasor is found to be unable to satisfy their share.

216.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
216.title: Merit System
216.description: Allows classified employee to be a candidate for elective state office.

217.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes -- Barrington
217.description: Changes the real property tax exemption for St. Andrew's School to five (5) acres.

218.title: Licenses Generally
218.description: Removes the prohibition of the town of Barrington from issuing Class A licenses.

219.title: Validating And Ratifying Amendments To Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Barrington
219.description: Ratifies and confirms November 4, 2014, amendments to the Barrington Home Rule Charter approved by the electors.

220.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
220.title: Sewage Charges
220.description: Authorizes municipal sewer systems to service/maintain lines in bordering city/town with no legal liability or agreement.

222.title: Harbors And Harbor Lines
222.description: Establishes an order of priority for persons applying for moorings, and would create a fee schedule for moorings.

225.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment, And Supplies
225.description: Allows bake sales to be held on election days at polling places.

226.last_action: House passed Sub A as amended (floor amendment)
226.title: Division Of Fire Safety
226.description: Authorizes state fire marshals to prohibit public adjusters from physical presence on and solicitation or inspection of the premises under investigation until twenty-four (24) hours after control of the premises is released to its owner or occupant.

227.title: The Rhode Island Automobile Repossession Act
227.description: Imposes a five hundred dollar ($500) fine for violations of the act after a hearing and conviction by the motor vehicle dealers' license and hearing board.

228.title: State Budget
228.description: Extends the deadline for the governor to submit to the general assembly the budget for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2016, not later than Thursday, March 12, 2015.

229.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
229.title: Rhode Island Resource Recovery Corporation
229.description: Allows the Rhode Island Resource Recovery Corporation to consider the use of incineration as a method to dispose of solid waste.

233.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
233.title: Auditor General
233.description: Enables the auditor general to take under investigation any matter within the scope of an audit.

234.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
234.title: Fiscal Notes
234.description: Requires an economic impact statement to accompany any proposed legislation affecting businesses operating in this state.

235.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
235.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes--liability And Computation
235.description: Exempts from the estate tax property used in the conduct of a trade or business to the value of five million dollars ($5,000,000).

238.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
238.title: Long-term Managed Care Arrangements
238.description: Requires managed care organizations to consult with the EOHHS to develop incentives for nursing facilities that demonstrate lower direct care staff turnover.

239.title: Employment Security--benefits
239.description: Eliminates the waiting period for individuals transitioning from temporary disability benefits to unemployment benefits.

241.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
241.title: Littering
241.description: Adds the delivery of unsolicited newspapers to private property to the definition of litter which is prohibited by law and subject to a monetary fine.

244.title: Burial Of Veterans
244.description: Prohibits the walking of any domestic animal on the grounds of the Veterans' Memorial Cemetery in Exeter with an exception for certified service dogs.

245.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
245.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Interest And Usury
245.description: Eliminates the exemption from the maximum interest rate for loans over one million dollars ($1,000,000).

248.title: Unpiloted Aerial Vehicle Regulation
248.description: Grants authority in the state of Rhode Island, to the exclusion of municipalities, to regulate unpiloted aerial vehicles.

250.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
250.title: Tax Sales
250.description: Provides that a collector's deed is not valid against intervening interests unless recorded within sixty (60) days after the sale unless the collector's return was recorded or posted in a timely manner.

252.title: Relating To Holidays And Days Of Special Observance
252.description: Sets aside the twenty-fifth day of September as Ataxia Awareness Day.

254.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
254.title: Statutory Interest
254.description: Decreases the interest on civil action money damage judgments from twelve percent (12%) per annum to six percent (6%) per annum.

255.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
255.title: Relating To Elections
255.description: Adds the secretary of state to the board of elections as a nonvoting ex officio member. Requires board of canvassers to clearly mark the fifty foot (50') buffer zone at each polling place where political campaigning is prohibited.

256.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
256.title: Procedure Generally -- Judgments, Orders And Decrees -- Interest On Judgments
256.description: Provides that interest on judgments would accrue from the date of the filing of the civil action and not the date the cause of action accrued. This would also apply to medical malpractice claims.

257.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
257.title: Code Of Conduct
257.description: Establishes conduct code for state/local elected public officials, employees, and candidates enforced by RI ethics commission effective 9/1/15.

259.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
259.title: Legislative Oversight Commission
259.description: Enables the secretary of the oversight commission to issue subpoenas upon a majority vote.

260.title: Vital Records
260.description: Provides that public can review death and marriage certificates but must redact all social security numbers with no fee charged for viewing any of said records.

261.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
261.title: Medical Assistance Fraud
261.description: Increase penalties for false statements made relative to certification or recertification of medical care facilities.

264.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
264.title: Unfair Sales Practices
264.description: Prohibits resale price maintenance in the contact lens market.

265.title: Fair Employment Practices
265.description: Prohibits an employer from terminating an employee for failing to report to regularly scheduled work when employee is responding to an emergency in his or her capacity as a volunteer firefighter or ambulance technician.

266.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
266.title: Relating To Labor And Labor Relations
266.description: Exempts school bus drivers laid off at the end of the school year, who have an agreement for or with a call-back date at the start of the next term, from the usual eligibility requirements for receipt of unemployment benefits.

267.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
267.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes - Tax Classification
267.description: Reduces the permitted differential between various classes of taxable property from fifty percent (50%) to twenty-five percent (25%).

268.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
268.title: Comprehensive Fire Safety Act
268.description: Changes various dates pertaining to safety code editions, would make word substitutions, alarm for detector, and would require delivery nozzles to comply with the Rhode Island Fire Code.

269.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Middletown
269.description: Ratifies the amendment to the Middletown town charter passed on November 4, 2014.

270.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
270.title: Comprehensive Planning And Land Use Act - Moratorium Comprehensive Permit Applications - Charlestown
270.description: Grants the town of Charlestown a moratorium until June 1, 2016, during which it would not be required to entertain, receive or consider comprehensive permit applications from for-profit developers.

271.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
271.title: Rhode Island Commerce Corporation
271.description: Directs the commerce corporation to facilitate the development of industrial parks located in any city or town by assisting in the pre-approval process for permitting on vacant parcels.

275.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
275.title: Cigarette Tax-minimum Price Of Cigarettes
275.description: Reduces the cigarette tax by fifty (50) cents per pack and require a fifteen percent (15%) minimum markup be added to the total cost of cigarettes sold by retailers.

277.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
277.title: The Rhode Island Health Benefits Exchange Act
277.description: Terminates "HealthSourceRI" and transfers its management and operation to the federal government beginning January 1, 2016.

278.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
278.description: Amends the provisions of the Education Equity and Property Tax Relief Act by freezing the amount of the regionalization bonus at two percent (2%).

280.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
280.title: Tourism And Development -- Distribution Of Hotel Tax For The City Of Newport
280.description: Increases the city of Newport's share of the hotels tax revenue generated by hotels located in the city of Newport.

283.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
283.title: Municipal Economic Development Zones
283.description: Expands the West Warwick municipal economic zone to the entire state in all municipally designated and state approved "growth centers" as defined by the Land-Use 2025 element of the state guide plan.

284.title: Student Loan Authority
284.description: Specifically empowers the Rhode Island Student Loan Authority to refinance and consolidate existing eligible loans. Authorizes the authority to purchase and invest in its own bonds and notes.

285.last_action: Committee transferred to House Municipal Government
285.title: Water Supply Facilities
285.description: Requires consent by a municipality of any land acquisition therein by the water resources board.

286.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
286.title: Public Service Corporation Tax
286.description: Provides that neither the Public Service Corporation Tax or the Sales Tax, which are paid by customers, would apply to any increase in electricity rates or charges which are greater than those in effect on December 31, 2014.

287.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
287.title: Temporary Disability Insurance - Contributions
287.description: Permits employees who are covered by employer sponsored disability insurance programs to elect to be exempt from the state temporary disability insurance program, provided the employer has submitted documentation to the director confirming such coverage.

288.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
288.title: Fire District Fiscal Stability
288.description: Establishes fiscal stability guidelines for fire districts.

289.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
289.title: Local Fire Districts
289.description: Requires that a quorum for all local fire district financial meetings be at least two percent (2%) of the total registered and qualified voting members of the fire district.

290.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
290.title: Fire District Meeting Notices
290.description: Establishes additional ways by which local fire districts would be required to notify their members of future meetings.

292.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
292.title: Rhode Island Works Program-- Compulsory Attendance
292.description: Requires an eighty percent (80%) school attendance rate for children in families receiving cash and medical assistance from the state as a condition of eligibility.

293.title: Relating To Human Services
293.description: Extends low income childcare benefits indefinitely by repealing the June 30, 2015 sunset provision from the law.

294.title: Sidewalks
294.description: Requires the DOT to complete snow removal on all sidewalks located on state highway overpasses, and on all pedestrian overhead walkways under the control of the state within (24) hours after the end of a snowstorm.

295.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
295.title: Municipal Employees Disputes
295.description: Expands compulsory binding arbitration subjects for municipal employees to include money matters with new arbitration factors and allows a collective bargaining agreement to continue while negotiations on a successor agreement takes place.

297.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
297.title: Saltwater Fishing License
297.description: Repeals the saltwater fishing license requirement.

299.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
299.title: Duties Of Utilities And Carriers
299.description: Requires National Grid to provide services applied for between November 1 and the subsequent April 30 within twenty-four (24) hours of application.

301.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
301.title: Child Safety
301.description: Makes it a felony for any party or witness in a child support calculation matter to provide the court with material misrepresentation or misinformation.

305.title: Minimum Wage - Gratuities
305.description: Raises the minimum wage for tipped workers to three dollars and thirty-nine cents ($3.39) per hour beginning January 1, 2016, and to three dollars and eighty-nine cents ($3.89) per hour, beginning January 1, 2017.

306.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
306.title: Condominium Law
306.description: Allows legal advertisements regarding condominium foreclosures to be published in certain public newspapers.

307.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
307.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses
307.description: Strengthens the criminal laws addressing persons who seek to avoid the proper payment of fares for mass transit.

308.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
308.title: Regulation Of Sales
308.description: Make the imposition of the penalties for possession of alcoholic beverages by under aged persons, discretionary as opposed to mandatory

311.title: Threats And Extortion
311.description: Adds court magistrates to the list of covered public officials that are protected from felonious threats.

312.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
312.title: Arrest
312.description: Adds juvenile program workers and shift coordinators of the department of children, youth, and families to the definition of peace officer.

313.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
313.title: Conduct Of Elections
313.description: Makes extensive changes to the election laws, including the definition of what a vote is, how to store ballots in cases of disputed results; allows a voter to take political paraphernalia into polling place and makes the Board decision subject to the APA.

314.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
314.title: Cell Phone Tracking
314.description: Absents exigent circumstances, mandates that law enforcement obtain a warrant before tracking any cell phone or other electronic device. It would also require disclosure to the subscriber of the phone or other device.

316.title: Medicare Supplement Insurance Policies
316.description: Expand the open enrollment period of all Medicare supplement insurance policies, or Medigap so that applications would be accepted anytime throughout the year.

317.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
317.title: Home Inspectors
317.description: Prohibits home inspectors or associate home inspectors from entering into contracts limiting their liability to less than $500,000.

319.title: Board Of Medical Licensure And Discipline
319.description: Renders restrictive covenants in employment agreements with physicians void and unenforceable.

320.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
320.title: The Naturopathic Physicians Act Of 2015
320.description: Establishes the practice of naturopathic medicine subject to oversight by the director of the department of health.

321.title: The Healing Art Of Acupuncture
321.description: Includes the term Oriental medicine in defining the scope and technique of acupuncture.

322.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
322.title: Relating To Education-unhealthy Food And Beverage Advertising
322.description: Prohibits on any school campus the advertising of any food or beverage that may not be sold on the campus during the school day.

324.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
324.title: Physician Assistants
324.description: Revises the definition and supervision standard of physician assistants, change the number and composition of the Board of Licensure of physician assistants, and more precisely identify the scope of practice of physician assistants.

325.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
325.title: Rhode Island Educational Records Bill Of Rights
325.description: Ensures parental access to information, materials or results to state assessments of students, including instructions, answer sheets and assessments. It prevents the collection of personally identifiable and personal data.

326.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
326.title: Comprehensive Health Insurance Program
326.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Comprehensive Health Insurance Program

327.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
327.title: Independent Contractor
327.description: Requires that the designation of a worker as an "independent contractor" form to be filed annually, with a fifty dollar ($50) filing fee with the director of revenue, and not the director of labor and training.

335.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
335.title: Injured Airport Firefighters
335.description: Entitles airport corporation rescue and firefighters to obtain injured in the line of duty benefits, if so qualified and would include injuries sustained while performing services for the executive military staff.

337.title: Retirement System - Contribution And Benefits
337.description: Includes the deputy sheriffs and capitol police, within the department of public safety, and DEM police, in provisions relating to retirement on service allowances.

338.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
338.title: Rhode Island Works Program
338.description: Includes Rhode Island Works Program participants who are full-time students in a post-secondary program for eligibility for child care assistance.

339.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
339.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions
339.description: Requires all commercial haulers of solid waste to be licensed by DBR, renewable every 5 years with penalties for violations.

341.title: Relating To Towns And Cities-wastewater Management Districts
341.description: Authorizes connection to existing sanitary sewer lines from facilities across city and town lines under certain circumstances.

342.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
342.title: Outdoor Advertising
342.description: Allows a change in outdoor advertisement copy by means of trivision technology or other equivalent technology without approval by the department of transportation or the federal highway administration.

343.title: Refuse Disposal
343.description: Grants the director of the department of environmental management the authority to issue emergency temporary refuse transfer licenses to existing collection stations or recycle centers.

344.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
344.title: Health And Safety Of Pupils - Fire Drills
344.description: Permits school building principals to delay holding fire and emergency egress evacuation drills in the months of December, January, and February due to severe inclement weather.

345.title: Traffic Safety Education
345.description: Requires state board of education approval of driver education courses for new drivers.

346.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
346.title: The Paul W. Crowley Rhode Island Student Investment Initiative
346.description: Requires the department of education to analyze certain costs to the state and municipalities which costs were incurred in conducting annual assessments of student performance.

348.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
348.title: Cruelty To Animals
348.description: Requires a court of competent jurisdiction to order the appointment of an animal care advocate where animal cruelty is at issue.

349.title: Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act
349.description: Creates the “Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act” for the purpose of regulating the official publication of legal material in an electronic record.

350.title: The Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act
350.description: Broadens the immunity from prosecution under the Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act and would eliminate the sunset provision.

352.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
352.title: Procedure Generally - Governmental Tort Liability
352.description: Restricts the tort liability of city, town or fire district employees or officials to those acts or omissions not performed within the scope of their employment or if actual fraud, malice or willful misconduct is involved.

353.title: Courts - District Court
353.description: Eliminates the responsibility of the division of public buildings, and department of administration to acquire suitable courtrooms for the sessions of the district court.

356.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
356.title: Telemedicine Reimbursement Act
356.description: Requires health insurance policies, plans or contracts to include provisions for the reimbursement to telemedicine services.

357.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
357.title: Weather Related Losses
357.description: Limits large windstorm insurance deductibles on commercial property insurance policies, and would also prohibit insurers from terminating commercial policies solely due to damages sustained from a catastrophic event.

359.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
359.title: Meaningful Access To Accurate Provider Directories
359.description: Requires health insurers to maintain accurate and up-to-date directories of all in-network providers, and to provide that information to plan enrollees. This act would take effect upon passage.

360.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Corporations
360.title: Rhode Island Well Drilling Contractors Licensing Law
360.description: Gives the contractor's registration and licensing board jurisdiction over pump installers, and/or water filtration/treatment system contractors.

361.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
361.title: Relating To Towns And Cities
361.description: Provides that municipal insurance corporations be regulated by the Rhode Island department of business regulation.

362.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
362.title: Farmer-winery Sales
362.description: Permits the sale of farmer-winery products at farmers' markets statewide.

363.title: Condominium Dispute Resolution
363.description: Establishes a voluntary arbitration proceeding for addressing the violations of condominium rules.

364.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
364.title: Veterinary Practice -- Animal As Security For Debt
364.description: Makes it a disciplinary offense for a veterinarian’s failure to return an animal after treatment, solely because of an unpaid bill.

365.title: Payments To Fire Companies
365.description: Requires reimbursement payments from the general fund to volunteer fire departments responding to emergencies on or along Route 95.

368.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
368.title: Health And Educational Building Corporation
368.description: Expands the powers of the Health and Educational Building Corporation in regard to the financing and granting of approval for school facility projects.

370.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
370.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act - School Funding Formula
370.description: Freezes the amount of education aid for local school agencies that are scheduled to receive less aid under the funding formula. The education aid would be frozen at the rate provided in fiscal year 2015 for a period of three (3) years.

371.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
371.title: Relief Of Injured And Deceased Firefighters And Police Officers
371.description: Includes campus police officers appointed by the Rhode Island Board of Education for purposes of injured on duty benefits.

372.title: Community College Of Rhode Island
372.description: Creates a two (2) year grant for qualifying students to attend the Community College of Rhode Island.

373.title: State Police
373.description: Provides that public safety officers employed by the State of Rhode Island, be considered members of the Rhode Island State Police for purposes of retirement benefits under this chapter.

374.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
374.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Liability Computation
374.description: Exempts from the sales and use tax, the purchase and use of telecommunication products or services that are necessary for the receipt or transmission of cable television or internet access services.

376.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
376.title: Public Corporation Debt Management
376.description: Provides that neither the general assembly or quasi-governmental entity shall issue any "moral obligation" bond (so called) not secured by the full faith and credit of the state without the question being approved by the voters of the state.

378.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
378.title: Sales And Use Taxes
378.description: Provides that a sales price for purposes of computing sales tax would not include consideration received by a retailer from a service provider in relation to the sale of a service agreement for cellular, mobile, or wireless telephones.

381.title: Wrongful Arrest - Mistaken Identity
381.description: Requires the sealing and destruction of all arrest records and indices of arrest for those persons who are wrongfully arrested or detained by any law enforcement agency.

382.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
382.title: Administrative Procedures
382.description: Subjects board of elections to provisions of APA.

383.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
383.title: Parole Board
383.description: Requires that parole board members serve no more than three (3) terms.

384.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
384.title: Relating To Aeronautics
384.description: Establishes registration requirements and operational restrictions for unpiloted aerial vehicles, remotely piloted aircraft and unmanned aircraft systems, and criminalizes the invasion of privacy by use of such aircraft.

385.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
385.title: Aerial Privacy Protection Act
385.description: Prohibits law enforcement from using unmanned aerial vehicles without a proper warrant.

386.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
386.title: Relating To Commercial Law - General Regulatory Provisions
386.description: Authorizes the attorney general and/or aggrieved persons to file a bad faith patent infringement suit seeking equitable and/or monetary relief including punitive damages in connection with frivolous patent infringement claims.

387.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
387.title: Sexual Offender Registration And Notification
387.description: Implements the federal Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (SORNA) (Title I of Public Law 109-248).

388.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
388.title: Preliminary Proceedings In District Courts
388.description: Provides for the transmission of a notice of violation to the arresting agency or place of presentment by the attorney general upon a finding of probable cause that a defendant is a violator of his or her bail or probation.

391.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A in concurrence
391.title: Motorcycles
391.description: Requires motor vehicle operator and chauffeur licenses valid for motorcycle operation, to state so conspicuously.

392.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
392.title: Relating To Statutes And Statutory Construction
392.description: Makes certain changes and technical corrections regarding the internal references to other provisions of the general laws.

393.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
393.title: Fraud And False Dealing

394.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
394.title: Mortgage Foreclosure And Sale
394.description: Reduces the time for filing a foreclosure deed from 15 days, and require mortgagees to file copies of foreclosure notices with city or town clerks and appoint an agent for service of process. Requires holders of vacant property to provide for maintenance.

397.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
397.title: Public Corruption And White Collar Crime Unit
397.description: Establishes a public corruption and white collar crime unit within the department of the attorney general for the purpose of prosecuting breaches of the public trust.

398.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
398.title: Crime Against The Public Trust

399.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

399.description: Prohibits state vendors from making political contributions to candidates for the office responsible for awarding those state vendor contracts.

400.description: Creates a new private cause of action against insurance companies that engage in unfair claims settlement practices and unfair and deceptive competition and practices.

401.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
401.title: Employment Of Women And Children
401.description: Requires a child14 years of age to complete a training program on worker rights for a work permit. Also mandates the department of labor and training to implement said program.

402.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
402.title: Firefighters' Arbitration
402.description: Includes platoon structure and/or shift schedule as items covered by collective bargaining for firefighters.

403.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
403.title: Workers' Compensation--general Provisions
403.description: Makes various changes to workers' compensation provisions defining leased and temporary employees and liability and benefit changes.

404.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
404.title: Arbitration -- Continuance Of Contractual Provisions
404.description: Requires that the contractual provisions contained in a collective bargaining agreement with certified school teachers and municipal employees would continue until a successor agreement has been reached between the parties.

406.last_action: Referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
406.title: General Provisions
406.description: Prohibits and/or regulates the possession or sale of shark fins.

407.title: The Permanent Air Quality Monitoring Act
407.description: Extends the sunset provision of the permanent air quality monitoring act until July 31, 2017.

408.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
408.title: Geoengineering
408.description: Defines and limit the use of geoengineering in the state.

409.title: Nurses
409.description: Repeals the nurse licensure compact wherein every nurse practicing in a party state must comply with the state practice laws in which the patient is located at the time care is rendered.

410.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
410.title: Rhode Island Information Exchange Act Of 2008
410.description: Requires HIE advisory commission with making strategic plan/recommendations to department of health for standards/infrastructure for EHR systems interoperability.

411.description: Reduces the amount a check cashing business can charge for deferred deposit transaction fees from ten percent (10%) to five percent (5%) of the funds advanced.

412.title: Motor Vehicle Body Replacement Parts
412.description: Amends the definition of the term "aftermarket part" to refer to all motor vehicle replacement parts, excluding windshields, rear and side windows, and any other vehicular glass, and amends the title of chapter 10.2 to reference the change.

414.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
414.title: Catastrophic Health Insurance Plan Act
414.description: Requires a public hearing for all insurers or health maintenance organizations who propose rates for health insurance coverage in the individual market.

415.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
415.title: Transportation Network Company Services
415.description: Creates a comprehensive regulatory scheme for transportation network companies and their services.

416.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
416.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers- Termination Of Water Service
416.description: Prohibits public utilities from terminating water service between January 1, and March 31.

417.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
417.title: Form And Effect Of Conveyances
417.description: Provides that all transfers of an interest in a mortgage be recorded and would prohibit the recording of mortgages and assignments in the name of a party other than the holder of the note secured by the mortgage.

418.title: Automobile Body Repair Shops
418.description: Creates two (2) classifications of full collision licensees for auto body repair facilities with the requirements for each. It would also clarify the auto body rate survey requirements.

419.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
419.title: Relating To Food And Drugs-regulation Of Powdered Caffeine
419.description: Prohibits the sale of powdered caffeine to any person under the age of twenty-one years of age and would prohibit the possession of powdered caffeine by anyone in that age group.

421.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

421.description: Requires all public schools in grades kindergarten through twelve (12), to have at least one full-time certified school social worker for every four hundred (400) students.

423.title: Pharmacies
423.description: Authorizes pharmacists to perform limited function clinical laboratory tests.

424.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
424.title: Personal Care Attendant Program
424.description: Requires registration of those individuals who provide personal care assistant services to a consumer.

427.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
427.title: Genetically Modified Organisms
427.description: Requires all food businesses, with the exception of restaurant's, who have gross sales of over $500,000 to post a sign informing their customers that all there food products contain modified organisms, unless there labels say otherwise.

428.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
428.title: Public Assistance
428.description: Requires public assistance recipients to perform community service.

430.title: Animal Care
430.description: Makes changes in the definitions of what constitutes unlawful confinement, and would apply them throughout the chapter accordingly.

431.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities
431.description: Specifies the maximum number of patients assigned to a registered nurse in various facilities.

432.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
432.title: Relating To Health And Safety- Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act
432.description: Creates the Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act, to provide a legal mechanism whereby a terminally ill patient may choose to end his or her life using drugs prescribed by a physician.

433.title: Reduce Marine Debris And Preserve Landfill Space While Increasing The Recycling Of Post-consumer Packaging Material
433.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Marine Debris Reduction Act.

434.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

434.description: Exempts purple heart recipients and honorably discharged veterans who were engaged in active combat or fighting in any war or armed conflict from paying user fees at any state beaches, parks, and recreational areas.

436.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

436.description: Permits free summer school attendance for students needing course credits to graduate.

437.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
437.title: Establishing A Program Within The Department Of Human Services To Provide For Emergency Housing Assistance
437.description: Establishes an emergency housing assistance fund to be administered by the department of human services in conjunction with community action program agencies.

439.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
439.title: Rhode Island Housing Resources Act Of 1998
439.description: Creates a specific appropriation for twelve million five hundred thousand dollars ($12,500,000) to be used by the housing resources commission in addition to the revenue generated from the current tax.

441.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
441.title: Veterans' Plates
441.description: Eliminates the service and transfer fees currently required to obtain or transfer a "veteran" or "war veteran" license plate.

442.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
442.title: Organization Of General Assembly
442.description: Requires the joint committee on legislative services to provide a hyperlink on the general assembly website to enable the public to immediately access the casting and recording of votes of the members of the general assembly.

445.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

445.description: Expands the definition of qualified businesses with respect to enterprise zones to include limited liability partnerships and any other form of business corporation.

447.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
447.title: Manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses
447.description: Reduces the licensing fee to $500 for any distillery producing less than 50,000 gallons per year and grants a tax exemption to distilleries doing business in RI for at least 12 months.

448.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
448.title: Construction And Maintenance Of State Roads
448.description: Requires cities or towns to implement a snow removal priority plan to place his or her importance on removing snow from certain roads and facilities.

449.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Glocester
449.description: Validates and ratifies amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the town of Glocester, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of Glocester on November 4, 2014.

450.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
450.title: Zoning Ordinances
450.description: Allows the owner of an owner-occupied single family home to build an accessory dwelling unit to house a member of the family who is sixty-two (62) years of age or older.

451.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
451.title: Truck Weight Limits
451.description: Prohibits commercial motor trucks or tractors with a gross weight exceeding four (4) tons from traveling on that portion of Route 116 known as Smith Avenue in the town of Smithfield.

452.title: Maintenance Of Town Highways - Hotline
452.description: Directs the department of transportation to set up a pothole report toll-free telephone line.

454.title: Start-up Rhode Island Tax Free Zone Program
454.description: Establishes the "Start-Up Rhode Island Act" to allow for the establishment of certain tax free zones in the state.

455.title: Budget Commission
455.description: Exempts fire districts from the provisions of the budget commission chapter.

456.title: Small Business Loan Program
456.description: Creates a transitioning veterans' small business loan program through the commerce corporation.

460.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

461.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

461.description: Increases child care eligibility for working families from 180% of federal poverty level to 225% effective 1/1/16.

462.title: Taxation - Impact Fees
462.description: Creates temporary reductions on certain fees and taxes relating to building and construction, specifically permit fees, impact fees and lumber and other building materials.

467.description: Establishes a formula for the assessment of municipal construction permit fees.

468.description: Recreates the urban infrastructure commission, which went out of existence in 2004. The purpose of the commission is to develop a state-supported economic development financing toll known as the urban renaissance fund.

469.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

469.description: Repeals the provisions of the general laws allowing deferred deposit providers, also known as "payday lenders."

470.description: Provides a higher rate of reimbursement to certain licensed child care providers or centers who have a valid National Child Care Accreditation.

471.title: Charter Schools
471.description: Requires the board of education to make certain findings regarding the sending districts before granting approval to a new charter school project.

472.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

472.description: Provides a six thousand dollar ($6,000) state funded exemption to the motor vehicle excise tax for residents of distressed communities beginning in fiscal year 2017.

476.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

479.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

490.description: Names the International Engineering Program House located at the University of Rhode Island, the "John Grandin IEP House."

497.description: Establishes a definition of "dyslexia" and makes certain findings about dyslexia.

498.title: Maternal And Child Health Services

499.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

507.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

522.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

524.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

530.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

533.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

534.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

534.description: Authorizes the parole board to terminate a parolee's supervision through finding that, after 7 years, certain parolees and/or probationers no longer require continued supervision,

535.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

538.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

547.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

552.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

564.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

566.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

570.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

572.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

575.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

576.description: Increases to 15 the membership of the Rhode Island Energy Efficiency and Resource Management Council.

578.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

585.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

588.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

592.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

596.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

600.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1365.description: Joint Resolution Making An Appropriation To Pay Certain Claims

1366.description: Joint Resolution Proclaiming September 13th Of 2015 As "national Grandparents Day" In The State Of Rhode Island
