1367.description: Joint Resolution Congratulating Susan Donovan On Receiving The 2015 Bristol 4th Of July Hattie Brown Award

1369.title: Rhode Island Works Program -- Compulsory Attendance
1369.description: Requires an eighty percent (80%) school attendance rate for children in families receiving cash and medical assistance from the state as a condition of eligibility. Parent/guardian would be required to attest to attendance rates.

1379.title: Performance Audits Of Governmental Entities
1379.description: Requires independent performance audits to be conducted periodically by the state auditor general.

1382.title: Personal Income Tax -- Exemption
1382.description: Exempts wages from state personal income taxes for individuals for each year before they reach twenty-two (22) years of age and for each year after they reached sixty-two (62) years of age.

1387.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1387.title: Long-term Economic Development
1387.description: Exempts the towns of Coventry, East Greenwich and West Greenwich from all the terms and provisions of § 42-64.17-1 entitled the "Long-Term Economic Development Vision and Policy."

1389.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes -- Coventry
1389.description: Permits the town of Coventry to adopt a tax classification plan including a class of mixed-use residential and commercial properties.

1395.title: Estate Tax
1395.description: Provides all net taxable estates with an exemption from the estate and transfer tax of up to the amount of two million five hundred thousand dollars ($2,500,000).

1396.title: Commerce Corporation
1396.description: Removes the restriction that projects be approved by the commerce corporation prior to July 12, 2011 to be eligible for exemption from taxation.

1398.title: In Amendment Of To Incorporate The Hopkins Hill Road Fire District
1398.description: In Amendment Of To Incorporate The Hopkins Hill Road Fire District

1405.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1405.title: Division Of Development Disabilities
1405.description: Requires a state reimbursement system for community and nonprofit agencies and increases pay rates for direct support professionals to $13.97 per hour.

1410.title: Relating To Taxation-personal Income Tax
1410.description: Subtracts state tax refunds, paid to an individual in the previous year, from federal adjusted gross income, for the purposes of the state income tax.

1423.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
1423.title: Initiative And Referendum
1423.description: Establishes a process for the establishment of voter initiative and referendum proposal and also for a process of submitting said proposals to the secretary of state, the general assembly and the governor for approval.

1427.title: Renewable Energy
1427.description: Changes the date the public utilities would issue an order in the docket as well as the effective date of any new rates.

1429.title: Laundries
1429.description: Requires dry cleaners to post a list containing retail prices charged for each type of garment, except garments requiring special handling or to display a printed flyer with prices in a conspicuous place.

1433.last_action: Senate passed Sub A as amended (floor amendment)
1433.title: The Education Equity And Property Relief Act
1433.description: Provides that a mayoral academy charter school's application would not be approved by the board of education unless the school committee and the city or town council of each included municipality also supported the application.

1436.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1436.title: Freshwater Fishing
1436.description: Permits fishing in trout waters at any time of year without seasonal restriction.

1437.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1437.title: Raw Milk
1437.description: Establishes procedures and standards promulgated by the milk commission for the handling and sale of raw milk in this state.

1439.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1439.title: Genetically Modified Organisms To Be Labeled
1439.description: Facilitators accurate labeling for food produced or made in Rhode Island containing generally modified organisms. Requires the manufacturer to label items before putting them for sale in Rhode Island.

1444.title: School Building Authority Capital Fund
1444.description: Expands the powers of the health and educational building corporation in regard to the financing and granting of approval for school facility projects and also provides for a seventy million dollar appropriation.

1445.title: Personal Income Tax-exemption For Retirement Income
1445.description: Exempts the first fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000) of personal income from a retirement plan from taxation.

1447.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1447.title: Business Corporation Tax And Franchise Tax
1447.description: Refunds a portion of the minimum tax paid to corporations whose gross receipts are less than five hundred dollars ($500), but never more than five hundred dollars ($500) minimum tax paid.

1449.title: The Education And Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
1449.description: Eliminates provisions of §16-7-34.3 re: reimbursement by the state for conventional public housing students and adds language to §16-7.2-6 to provide permanent foundation education aid funding for services for students residing in such housing.

1452.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1452.title: Fire Districts Located In Coventry
1452.description: Gradually make fire districts in Coventry subject to the maximum levy.

1458.title: Income Tax Refunds - State Tax Officials
1458.description: Gives all state income tax return filers the option to have their tax refund directly deposited into their bank account.

1466.title: Stay Invested In Ri Wavemaker Fellowship
1466.description: Creates the Stay Invested in RI Tax Credit authorizing a tax credit against state personal income tax for up to ten (10) years after graduation from an institution of higher education, for graduates who reside and work in Rhode Island.

1469.title: Select Commission To Investigate The Failure Of Public Loan Guarantee Programs
1469.description: Establishes a select commission to investigate the failure of public loan guarantee programs and prescribes its powers and duties.

1474.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A
1474.title: Procedure Generally - Causes Of Action
1474.description: Creates a cause of action for employees who are discharged or otherwise sanctioned by an employer on account of being required to attend court or other hearing pursuant to a validly issued subpoena.

1484.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Oscar Glieberman, M.d., A Professional Corporation
1484.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Oscar Glieberman, M.d., A Professional Corporation

1486.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1486.title: Licensed Activities - Lenders And Loan Brokers - Check Cashing
1486.description: Separates the statutes for "check cashing" and "payday lending".

1487.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1487.title: Commercial Billing
1487.description: Limits the number of commercial customers of electric distribution companies that are required to maintain security deposits for electric utility accounts.

1502.title: Access To Abuse-deterrent Pain Medications
1502.description: Requires policies and plans issued by health insurers to cover abuse-deterrent drug formulations of opioid analgesics in the same manner in which the policies and plans cover non-abuse deterrent drugs formations.

1503.title: Health Maintenance Organizations
1503.description: Prohibits a group health plan and a health insurance issuer from discriminating with respect to participation under plan or coverage against any health care provider acting within scope of provider's license or certification under state law.

1507.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1507.title: Rhode Island Housing Resources Act Of 1998--moblie Homes--town Of Coventry
1507.description: Includes mobile homes in the town of Coventry in the definition of affordable housing for the purposes of the Rhode Island resources act.

1508.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1508.title: Driving Under The Influence Of Liquor Or Drugs
1508.description: Extends the time period from five (5) years to ten (10) years for persons convicted of driving under the influence of liquor or drugs as it relates to the penalties applicable for first, second, and/or third convictions of this offense.

1516.title: Work On Holidays And Sundays
1516.description: Allows a Rhode Island employer some flexibility to reschedule the observance of state holidays that Congress doesn't recognize as national public holidays.

1517.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1517.title: Temporary Disability Insurance
1517.description: Permits employees covered by employer-sponsored disability insurance to opt out of state temporary disability insurance program provided that the employer submits documentation confirming coverage.

1519.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1519.title: Workers' Compensation -- Medical Services
1519.description: Requires employers to pay the reasonable transportation costs for employees that travel round-trip to receive workers' compensation related healthcare services.

1520.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1520.title: Workers' Compensation Benefits
1520.description: Eliminates workers' compensation benefits for partial incapacity.

1522.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1522.title: The Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices, And Other State Constructions
1522.description: Renames the bridge in the city of Providence known as the I-195 Providence River Bridge: No. 1181 to the William D. Warner Memorial Bridge.

1524.title: Relating To Days Of Special Observance
1524.description: Sets aside the twenty-fifth day of September annually to be known as Ataxia Awareness Day.

1529.title: Produce Scales In Markets
1529.description: Requires sealers of weights and measures appointed by the cities or towns to receive the same fees as charged by state sealers who perform the same inspecting/testing services.

1530.title: Teachers' Tenure -- Hearings
1530.description: Provides that teacher dismissal cases may be heard by less than an entire school board.

1533.title: Permit Program For Cats
1533.description: Requires owners of cats to have the cat licensed, collared and inoculated or be subject to fines.

1534.last_action: Referred to House Environment and Natural Resources
1534.title: Livestock Dealers
1534.description: Repeals the statutory requirement that livestock dealers have a DEM-issued license plate, and requires livestock dealers to care for animals in their custody according to standards adopted by the RI livestock welfare and care standards advisory council.

1535.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1535.title: Proper Management Of Unused Paint
1535.description: Exempts latex paint sold on or after January 1, 2016 from fee assessment imposed under the paint stewardship program.

1536.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
1536.title: Outdoor Wood-fired Hydronic Heaters
1536.description: Regulates the sale and installation of outdoor wood-fired hydronic heaters.

1551.title: Correctional Healthcare Act
1551.description: Establishes procedures that would reduce the state's correctional inmate healthcare costs.

1554.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1554.title: Department Of Environmental Management - User Fees
1554.description: Increases the percentage of state beach fees payable to the city or town where the facility is located from sixteen percent (16%) to twenty percent (20%).

1557.title: Professional Employer Organization Act Of 2004
1557.description: Eliminates the exemption from bonding requirements for professional employer organizations that have been certified by the division of taxation for at least two (2) years.

1563.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1563.title: Nonprofit Dental Service Corporations
1563.description: Requires nonprofit dental service plan providers to provide notice of any changes relating to coverage to all plan purchasers purchasing dental services for employees under a group or individual policy contract or health benefit plan.

1564.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1564.title: Rare Disease Community Support, Resource Coordination, And Quality Of Life Act Of 2015
1564.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Rare Disease Community Advisory Council.

1567.title: State Affairs And Government
1567.description: Requires persons in government custody use actual residence for census and redistricting purposes as determined by department of corrections and secretary of state.

1568.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1568.title: Suspension Or Revocation Of Licenses - Violations
1568.description: Mandates that the police confiscate the license plates from a vehicle when making an arrest for operating on a suspended license due to a conviction for DUI or breathalyzer refusal.

1570.title: Electronic Voting
1570.description: Requires the joint committee on legislative services to make the record of the votes of the general assembly available to the public and the secretary of state electronically within thirty (30) minutes of the casting of said vote.

1580.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1580.title: Hunting And Hunting Safety
1580.description: Changes the maximum size of shotgun shells a person may have in his or her possession while hunting from a number two (no. 2) shot to a 00 ("double-aught") shot.

1587.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1587.title: Immigration Status
1587.description: Prohibits a landlord from asking about the immigration status of a prospective tenant.

1588.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1588.title: Left Turn Penalties
1588.description: Increases the penalties for illegal left turns that occur on Route 1 in North and South Kingstown.

1590.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1590.title: Attorney's Fees
1590.description: Authorizes a court, in a breach of contract lawsuit, to award attorney’s fees to the successful defendant.

1592.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1592.title: Criminal Intent
1592.description: Requires each element of a criminal offense be considered proven only after criminal intent is established.

1593.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1593.title: Nontransparent Windshields And Windows
1593.description: Increases the allowable window tinting on the side and rear windows of a motor vehicle.

1594.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1594.title: Wastewater Treatment Plants
1594.description: Requires a notice and opportunity to be heard by the public with regard to the permitting of wastewater treatment facilities.

1598.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1598.title: Limited Guardianship And Guardianship Of Adults
1598.description: Requires that legally appointed guardians, whether temporary or permanent, file for their ward, a durable power of attorney for health care and/or a living will within thirty (30) days of appointment and to adhere to the expressed wishes of their ward.

1605.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1605.title: Workers' Compensation--benefits
1605.description: Increases the spendable base wage calculation from seventy-five percent (75%) to eighty-five percent (85%) under the workers' compensation law and makes additional changes relating to partial incapacity.

1608.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1608.title: Access To Public Records
1608.description: Provides an exemption to the access to public records law for winners of lottery prizes.

1609.title: Renaming Bridge #672 Located On Route 102 And Branch River In The Town Of Burrillville
1609.description: Names bridge #672 in the town of Burrillville as "The PFC Allen B. McCutcheon and PFC James A. Blanchard Memorial Bridge.

1641.title: Gender Rating
1641.description: Provides that insurance companies shall not vary the premium rates charged for a health coverage plan based on the gender of the individual policy holder, enrollee, subscriber, or member.

1646.title: Relating To The Uniformed Controlled Substances Act
1646.description: Transfers approval drug awareness programs for minors to the department of behavioral health care, developmental disabilities and hospitals, and mandate that BHDDH establish criteria for distribution of funds aims at substance abuse prevention.

1648.title: Health And Safety - Licensing Of Health Care Facilities
1648.description: Requires hospitals to provide within five (5) days, upon request, a written estimate for hospital services to those people without health coverage or those with insurance carrying a five thousand dollar ($5,000) deductible or higher.

1652.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1652.title: Nurses - Nurse Licensure Compact
1652.description: Repeals the nurse licensure compact law and directs the department of health to develop a multi-state compact for nurses licensed in Rhode Island, Connecticut and Massachusetts.

1656.title: Trespass And Vandalism
1656.description: Requires a property owner to maintain trees or shrubs that create a nuisance to an abutting property owner.

1660.title: Exploding Targets
1660.description: Prohibits the possession, sale and/or use of "exploding targets".

1666.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1666.title: Sexual Offender Registration And Community Notification
1666.description: Includes persons who have been convicted of murder as defined in § 11-23-1 within the class of persons which would be subject to the sexual offender registration and community notification provisions of the general laws.

1668.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1668.title: Wildlife Refuges
1668.description: Provides a protected area around recognized wildlife refuges in which hunting with weapons would be prohibited.

1677.title: The Rhode Island Uniform Commercial Driver's License Act
1677.description: Extends the commercial learner's permit from the current ninety days to one hundred eighty days and would establish learner's permit fees.

1682.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1682.title: Excavation Near Underground Utility Facilities -- Costs
1682.description: Provides all costs incurred by municipal corporations associated with temporary permanent relocation of utility infrastructure such as public utility poles during public works projects within municipal rights-of-way would be borne by the public utility.

1687.title: Business Tax Credit
1687.description: Creates a tax credit for businesses that provide English language classes for its non-English speaking employees.

1689.title: Medicare Exchange Program For Medicare-eligible Retirees
1689.description: Reverts back from the most recent changes in the general laws concerning the method process for which the state pays for medical coverage for Medicare-eligible state and teacher retirees.

1696.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1696.title: Immunizations
1696.description: Removes the religious beliefs exemption from the requirement that all pupils in a public or private school in this state be immunized and/or tested for communicable diseases.

1697.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1697.title: Health Benefit Plan Network Access And Adequacy Act
1697.description: Establishes criteria by which the office of the health insurance commissioner shall review and regulate the adequacy of health plan networks.

1700.title: Unclaimed Intangible And Tangible Property
1700.description: Allows law enforcement agencies to keep the proceeds from confiscated property for law enforcement purposes.

1702.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1702.title: Immigrant Assistance In Crime Fighting
1702.description: Prohibits law enforcement or other state or local agency from inquiring into a complainant's or witness's immigration status if such person is the complaining party or witness to a violation of state or local law.

1710.title: Relating To Public Property And Works- Minority Business Enterprise
1710.description: Provides that any minority business enterprise that is certified by the Small Business Act shall be deemed certified by the department of administration as a minority business enterprise.

1712.title: Motor Vehicle Reparations Act
1712.description: Creates a rebuttable presumption of vehicle owner's knowledge that a vehicle did not comply with financial security requirements.

1716.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1716.title: Protecting Student Privacy On School-owned Technology
1716.description: Establishes certain student privacy rights in regard to take-home technology devices from school.

1723.title: Rhode Island Energy Resources Act
1723.description: Requires office energy resources to assemble task forces to report on development of alternative fuel markets/least cost procurement for delivered fuels with recommendations to the governor by January 31, 2016.

1729.title: Carbon Pricing And Economic Development Investment Act Of 2015
1729.description: Imposes an excise tax on all fossil fuels entering the state for the purpose of funding a "clean energy fund."

1737.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1737.title: Relating To Towns And Cites
1737.description: Requires municipalities to include in their comprehensive plans a process to permit accessory agriculture operations.

1745.title: Resident Driver Authorization
1745.description: Allows for the issuance of a special driver's license to persons unable to provide a social security number or other information.

1746.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1746.title: City Housing Authorities
1746.description: Requires prospective elderly tenants for federally subsidized housing get a FBI criminal records check.

1748.title: Public Assistance Act -- Drug Testing
1748.description: Authorize random drug screening as a condition for continued public assistance, and would provide a mechanism for re-testing those who fail the test.

1751.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1751.title: Electronic Marijuana-delivery Systems
1751.description: Defines and regulates the use of electronic marijuana delivery system products.

1761.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Newbell, Inc.
1761.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Newbell, Inc.

1768.title: Licensing And Monitoring Of Child Care Providers And Child-placing Agencies
1768.description: Imposes a moratorium on the application of certain rules and regulations concerning day care centers.

1772.title: Office Of Health And Human Services--able Accounts
1772.description: Establishes private savings (ABLE) account for qualifying disabled persons wherein monies grow tax free and used for qualifying expenses per Section 529A of Internal Revenue Service Code.

1776.title: Unfair Sales Practices--cigarette Tax
1776.description: Repeals unfair uniform sales practices law as to transactions between wholesalers and retailers.

1786.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1786.title: Health And Safety Of Students
1786.description: Requires health examinations and dental screenings for school children be performed by a licensed dentist or a licensed public health dental hygienist.

1793.title: Rate Review Act
1793.description: Creates a uniform rate review procedure for health insurance policies issued by non-profit hospitals, medical services corporations and catastrophic health insurance companies, by requiring public hearings and meetings.

1794.title: Determination Of Need For New Health Care Equipment And New Institutional Health Services
1794.description: A moratorium on the licensing of home health care agencies.

1801.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A
1801.title: Health Care Accessibility And Quality Assurance Act
1801.description: Requires that health care facilities seek the use of licensed Rhode Island nurses to satisfy staffing needs but would permit exceptions in certain emergency situations.

1806.title: Joint Committee On Legislative Services
1806.description: Senate majority leader is made a member of the joint committee on legislative services.

1811.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1811.title: Suspension Or Revocation Of Licenses--violations
1811.description: Changes first and second offenses for driving with a suspended or expired license to civil violations and would also reduce the potential monetary penalty.

1823.title: Gun Control And Safe Firearms Act
1823.description: Impose restrictions on the manufacture, transfer and possession of certain semiautomatic assault weapons.

1825.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1825.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure
1825.description: Promulgates standards of probable cause or reasonable suspicion before a detainee in the custody of law enforcement can be subjected to a strip or a body cavity search, and would establish procedures to be followed before any such a search.

1833.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1833.title: Jurisdiction And Venue Of Offenses
1833.description: Repeals the provisions placing jurisdiction of criminal offenses that occur on the waters of Narragansett Bay in the First and Fifth divisions of the court and permit the Chief Judge to transfer any case to any other division.

1837.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1837.title: Interest Arbitration Police And Fire
1837.description: Extends any existing collective bargaining agreements for firefighters and municipal police until a successor agreement has been reached or an interest arbitration award has been rendered.

1838.title: Governor's Workforce Board Rhode Island
1838.description: Increases the number of the Governor's workforce from twenty-one (21) to twenty-two (22) and would add a member from a community-based organization that would provide substance use disorder recovery support services.

1848.last_action: Senate voted to recommit to Senate Finance
1848.title: Rhode Island Turnpike And Bridge Authority Bonds
1848.description: Authorizes the Rhode Island Turnpike and Bridge Authority to include language establishing the rights of the holders with any agreement it makes with the holders of bonds or notes issued by it.

1851.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1851.title: Taxation
1851.description: Repeals the five hundred dollar ($500) minimum tax on corporations, limited liability companies and limited partnerships.

1854.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1854.title: Labeling Of Genetically Engineered Raw And Packaged Food Products
1854.description: Requires that all genetically engineered food offered for retail sale in this state contain a label with the disclosure that the food is genetically engineered food.

1858.title: Self-insurance Of Developmental Disability Agencies
1858.description: Authorizes operators of developmental disability agencies acting as a group, to self-insure healthcare costs for employees, retirees and other beneficiaries, and allows a qualified third-party administrator to administer said program.

1878.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1878.title: Public Use Of Private Lands--liability Limitations
1878.description: Changes the definition of "owner" to exclude the state and municipalities for the purposes of liability limitations relating to public use of private lands.

1887.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act--family Court Proceedings
1887.description: Transfers jurisdiction of possession of one ounce (1 oz.) or less of marijuana by person under age of eighteen (18) to family court.

1896.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1896.title: Willful Trespass, Disorderly Conduct, And Shoplifting
1896.description: Provides heightened penalties, including imprisonment, for certain actions deemed lascivious or those in violation of The Domestic Violence Prevention Act.

1902.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1902.title: Workers' Compensation - General Provisions
1902.description: Establishes definitions for leased and temporary employees for workers' compensation benefits. It also addresses the workers' compensation potential liability for "special employers."

1910.title: Health Care For Families
1910.description: Expands the income disregards or other methodology for parents or relative caretakers eligible for medical assistance.

1913.title: Unclaimed Property
1913.description: Required that, before any account surplus from the treasurer's unclaimed intangible and tangible property fund is transferred to the general fund, five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000) shall be paid to Rhode Island Legal Services.

1918.title: Stroke Prevention And Treatment Act Of 2009
1918.description: Sets standards for recognition of comprehensive stroke care centers.

1919.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1919.title: Health Insurance Oversight
1919.description: Directs the insurance commissioner to adopt a single payer health care system for primary and preventative care.

1920.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1920.title: Relating To Health And Safety-office Of Health Policy
1920.description: Establishes the office of health policy for the purpose of establishing a comprehensive health policy and management system for the state.

1926.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1926.title: Elective Meetings
1926.description: Creates a process for in-person early voting before the actual election day.

1933.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1933.title: Campaign Contributors
1933.description: Clarifies independent advocate campaign finance reporting requirements and exempts candidates who fund their campaigns or receive party in-kind contributions from annual filing requirements.

1939.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1939.title: Relating Elections - Mail Ballot
1939.description: Allows a voter who has applied for a mail ballot to cast a provisional ballot.

1943.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1943.title: Relief Of Injured And Deceased Fire Fighters And Police Officers
1943.description: Redefines the method by which a police officer will be considered "totally and permanently disabled" under this section.

1947.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1947.title: Registration Fees
1947.description: Provides for a one year registration or renewal for leased vehicles having less than a year remaining on the lease term.

1952.title: Office Of Health And Human Services
1952.description: Requires creation of an evidence-based behavioral health care program for incarcerated adults with co-occurring substance use and mental disorders.

1957.title: Alterations Of Units
1957.description: Allows a unit owner to improve or alter a unit beyond its existing footprint if the unit is a free standing unattached unit and the condominium declaration permits the same.

1960.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
1960.title: Consumer Car Information And Choice Act
1960.description: Regulates the generation, collection, analysis, dissemination and sharing of connected car vehicle data.

1964.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Joint And Several Liability
1964.description: Limits liability of tortfeasor for damages to several only and not joint if defendant's act on omission is no more than 25% of damages.

1969.title: Comprehensive Community-police Relationship Act Of 2015
1969.description: Amend the racial profiling act to require searches to be documented, to set rules regarding the recordation of stops, the maintenance of any recordings, the completion of reports and prohibits the search of juveniles without probable cause.

1972.title: Department Of Public Safety
1972.description: Makes the department of public safety responsible for the management and administration of traffic tribunal security officers.

1974.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1974.title: Special Police For Private Institutions
1974.description: Provides that special police officers have limited jurisdiction on public streets and highway corridors between an educational institution buildings and land areas.

1988.title: Relating To Education-- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1988.description: Authorizes the council on post-secondary education to consolidate services within the state's three (3) colleges and university.

1992.title: Amount Of Catch
1992.description: Makes changes to the process for setting marine species catch limits.

2002.title: Rights Of Patients - Medical Record Fees For Veterans
2002.description: Requires healthcare providers to provide veterans copies of their medical records at no charge if the records are used to apply for benefits of any kind.

2030.title: Tuition For Covered Individuals Under A Post-911 Gi Bill And Montgomery Gi Bill
2030.description: Allows qualifying veterans/spouses/children under 25 years old to pay resident tuition/fees at state colleges upon filing a letter of intent to reside in the state while so enrolled.

2034.title: Mental Health Law
2034.description: Allows DBHDDH to receive medical/mental health records in abuse, neglect, mistreatment, exploitation cases of elderly, disabled residents without a release.

2051.title: Automobile Body Repair Shop Licenses
2051.description: Creates two (2) classifications of full collision licensees for auto body repair facilities with the requirements for each. It would also clarify the auto body rate survey requirements.

2053.title: Contractors' Bonds
2053.description: Prohibits the state, general contractors, and construction managers from withholding more than 5% as a retainer with respect to any sewer, water main, or other public works construction contract.

2066.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2066.title: Willful Trespass
2066.description: Amends the penalty provision for willful trespass and provide for a fine not exceeding five hundred dollars ($500) for a first offense and a fine not exceeding one thousand dollars ($1,000) for a third or subsequent offense.

2090.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2090.title: Establishment Of The Community Senior Services Grant Program
2090.description: Establishes the community senior services grant program in the division of elderly affairs to provide financial assistance and incentives to local governments and nonprofit agencies to help older residents remain living in the community.

2095.title: North Kingstown Municipal Court
2095.description: Grants the North Kingstown Municipal Court the power to issue arrest warrants.

2101.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
2101.title: The Providence Port Advisory Council
2101.description: Creates the Rhode Island Port Advisory Council to provide advice and support with respect to coordinating and marketing the commercial maritime resources of all ports in the state.

2111.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2111.title: Retirement System--contribution And Benefits
2111.description: Makes various revisions to the retirement provisions for many state and municipal employees.

2115.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2115.title: Sexual Assault
2115.description: Increases the minimum penalty for first degree sexual assault from ten (10) to twenty (20) years. The act would also create a category of cases wherein the first ten (10) years of any sentence be ineligible for the benefits of deferment or suspension.

2117.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2117.title: Motor Vehicle Offenses - The Tiffany Sical Act
2117.description: Makes driving under the influence of liquor or drugs, resulting in death a non-bailable offense subject to life imprisonment and a fine of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) to twenty thousand dollars ($20,000) for offenses committed on or after July 1, 2015.

2122.title: Durable Medical Equipment Freedom Of Choice
2122.description: Creates regulatory procedures to ensure fair and competitive bidding among providers of durable medical equipment.

2127.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
2127.title: Governor And Lieutenant Governor
2127.description: Provides candidates for governor and lieutenant governor would run on a joint ticket.

2133.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
2133.title: Biodiesel Heating Oil Act Of 2013
2133.description: Replaces DEM director with the director of the office of energy resources to administer and enforce the law on biodiesel heating oil. Establishes a procedure to obtain a suspension from compliance when there is an inadequate supply of bio-based products.

2134.title: Retirement System-contributions And Benefits
2134.description: Adds to the list of department of corrections position classifications eligible to retire under the formula set forth under the retirement-on-service allowance formula for correctional officers.

2136.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2136.title: Accidental Disability Allowance
2136.description: Reduces a disabled municipal employee's disability allowance for any application submitted on or after July 1, 2015, when the employee is permanently and totally disabled from state service, but not from all employment.

2139.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2139.title: Correctional Officer Employer-employee Relations Act
2139.description: Establishes procedures which the state must follow when investigating and or disciplining correctional officers.

2141.title: Corrections Department--sickness And Injury Pay For Corrections Personnel
2141.description: Provides corrections personnel working in security or directly with inmates full pay and benefits, including reimbursement for non-insurance paid medical expenses.

2171.last_action: Senate voted to recommit to Senate Finance
2171.title: Public Finance Management Board
2171.description: Adds guidelines for the board of public finance management to consider when allocating bond issuance capacity.

2177.title: Bridge And Turnpike Authority - Tolls
2177.description: Creates a process for the replacement, reconstruction, and maintenance of all bridges in Rhode Island, except the Newport, Mount Hope, Jamestown-Verrazzano and Sakonnet River bridges, through the limited tolls of large commercial trucks.

2188.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Copyfax, Inc.
